channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: Thief makes off with $80K in whipped cream during Ontario trailer heist
item.description: Guelph police are looking for a suspect who allegedly whipped up a creamy heist earlier this week. Just before 11 a.m. Wednesday, police said a manager from a business on Speedvale Avenue West reported a trailer had been stolen earlier in the morning. At approximately 4:30 a.m. Oct. 28, a white Wabash refrigerated trailer was...
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Some P.E.I. municipalities postpone Halloween due to messy weather forecast
item.description: Some trick-or-treaters in P.E.I. will have to wait an extra night for Halloween festivities as Environment Canada has issued a special weather statement warning that heavy rain and wind are expected to hit the Island on Friday.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Carney is set to announce immigration plan. Where do levels stand now?
item.description: Speaking to students at the University of Ottawa last week, Prime Minister Mark Carney said his government was also going to work on reducing immigration levels.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Speed cameras across Ontario to be removed in 2 weeks, transportation minister says
item.description: Ontario's transportation minister says speed cameras across the province are set to be removed in two weeks, after Premier Doug Ford's government passed legislation Thursday to ban them.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: India slaps yellow pea imports with 30% duty
item.description: India is adding an additional duty of 30 per cent for all imports of yellow peas effective Nov. 1, including from Canada, in an effort to maintain local price stability.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: 'Sometimes it actually happens': One vote decides final Banff council spot
item.description: New Banff councillor Michelle Backhouse won by one vote, while candidate Allan Buckingham fell short by one vote in seeking a spot on council in the 2025 Alberta municipal election.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: General strike in Alberta possible after back-to-work legislation

item.title: ‘Forever Canadian’ Results Shock the UCP Government
item.description: Thomas Lukaszuk delivers petitions signed by over 456,000 citizens, upsetting separatist referendum plans.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: CBSA reports huge Chinese drug chemical seizure ahead of Carney-Xi meeting
item.description: The seizure occurred in May at the Tsawwassen Container Examination Facility in B.C., but was reported by CBSA on Thursday — one day before Carney and Xi are set to meet.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Spending soared in Toronto as Blue Jays entered World Series, data shows
item.description: The Toronto Blue Jays have two chances to create history and win the World Series, but restaurants in the city are already feeling the Jays effect as sales spike in the city.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Alberta’s Big Payouts to Spurned Australian Coal Miners
item.description: Two firms that invested far less are getting $238 million. Taxpayers face more such hits.
